intro: Zerumbet zeylanica, commonly known as the yellow ginger or golden ginger, is a tropical herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and turmeric. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Zerumbet zeylanica thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
